author: @73elephants
text:
Her name is Olukemi ("Kemi" for short) Olufunto Badenoch (née Adegoke). Apart from the Scottish surname from her husband, the rest of her name tells us that she's ethnically Yoruba. The Yoruba homeland is South-Western Nigeria.
She has three kids and a good CV. She looks like a very promising asset to the party.

author: @flaminghulaballoo
text: Conservative ideology should be based on saying NO to democratic excesses.  Pretty much just that.  As Thomas Sowell once said, regarding the US congress:  gridlock is not a political failure, but a political success.  Stopping up the works on liberal democratic, and particularly ideological, over-reach is essential.  The greatest trick the government ever pulls is convincing you that you need it.

author: @gideonhorwitz9434
text: When one thinks of conservative Prime minister to me only 2 names come to mind Winston Churchill and Margret Thatcher. Britain has had supposedly conservative PMs before and after them but these two stand out for one fundamental reason they were conservatives that actually believes in something they weren’t Tory wets that were meek managing Britain’s decline they actually stood up for Britain and didn’t take shit from anyone. How many people born in the 21st century who don’t know much about post war British politics remember Anthony Eden, Harold Macmillan Edward Heath or John major. Each one of these uninspiring men left Britain worse of than they left it.

author: @adamdalgleish8769
text: Regarding using the language of leftist ideology without knowing it, look up the origins of the term "Middle Class". They give credibility to their ideas by trying to use them against the left basically.

author: @pyrosapien4028
text: Why the lotus eaters?

replies.author: @greulich9635
replies.text:
From Wikipedia "In Greek mythology the lotus-eaters (Greek: λωτοφάγοι), were a race of people living on an island dominated by the lotus tree, a plant whose botanical identity (if based on a real plant at all) is uncertain. The lotus fruits and flowers were the primary food of the island and were a narcotic, causing the inhabitants to sleep in peaceful apathy. After they ate the lotus they would forget their home and loved ones. Those who ate the plant never cared to report, nor return.

Figuratively, 'lotus-eater' denotes "a person who spends their time indulging in pleasure and luxury rather than dealing with practical concerns". "

author: @EtherasFox
text:
Not to be contrarian, but there's a saying "A rose by any other name smells just as sweet".
"Reactionary" is only a pejorative because of the framing. Both "Capitalism" and "Democracy" were pejoratives too, but over time, the goodness of these things reclaimed the word. Now they're both (largely) considered compliments.

Meanwhile, labels with positive connotations adopted by the left eventually became pejoratives. People forget, the term "SJW" wasn't invented by our side. "Social Justice" puts a foul taste in the mouths of even the normies today. Or "Antifa". "Anti-Fascist" must be good, right? But now the media runs from it, saying "It doesn't exist".

It reminds me of lefty browbeating over words. "Retarded" is a word clinicians used to denote the developmentally disabled. Now that's considered mean and they use words like "Developmentally disabled" or "Differently-abled" or whatever nonsense. Before that, they were called "Morons", and before that, "Idiots". But... the word is just a vessel for a concept. No matter how they color it, its always going to be an insult, because the word itself is nothing. It will always be an insult to call someone retarded, no matter what term is "sanctioned" by the mores of the day.

I've heard that now "Homosexual" is insulting. Now "Gay" is the accepted word. Not long ago, that was inverted. Because no matter what term you use, it means guys who like to suck other guys dicks, and being accused of that offends people. No matter what you call it, its going to be weird and funny and disreputable, because the act is weird and funny and disreputable.
